bibl.title: P. Mich. Inv. 4922: Xenophon and an Unknown Christian Text with an Appendix of All Xenophon Papyri.
bibl.note: The papyrus contains two texts: A. Portions of Xenophon's Cyropaedia (II 1.10-11; II 1.11-12; II 2.19-20), written in a roll form, I/II A.D.; B. An unknown Christian homily, forming neither a roll nor a codex, IV/V A.D. Provenance unknown. - Pp. 186-189: Appendix. The surviving Xenophon papyri from the ancient world. - P. 190: Addendum. The situation of the texts is similar to that of P. KÃ¶ln VII, 297.
DILLERY John D. and Traianos GAGOS, P. Mich. Inv. 4922: Xenophon and an Unknown Christian Text with an Appendix of All Xenophon Papyri.
